options.text: Yes, I thrive in brainstorming sessions.
I enjoy them occasionally.
No, I don't particularly enjoy brainstorming.

questions.question: Have you ever taken a novel approach to solving a problem, diverging from the conventional methods?

options.text: Yes, I've taken unconventional approaches.
I've tried unconventional approaches occasionally.
No, I usually stick to conventional methods.

options.text: Yes, I enjoy experimenting with new techniques and technologies.
I experiment occasionally.
No, I prefer sticking to familiar techniques.

questions.question: Can you easily visualize scenarios that don't currently exist and imagine potential outcomes?

options.text: Yes, I can vividly imagine different scenarios.
I can imagine scenarios to some extent.
No, I have difficulty imagining different scenarios.

questions.question: Do you enjoy immersing yourself in creative projects, even if they require significant time and effort?

options.text: Yes, I'm passionate about creative projects.
I enjoy creative projects but balance them with other activities.
No, I don't invest much time in creative projects.

questions.question: Are you comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty, often exploring new paths and embracing the unknown?

options.text: Yes, I'm comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty.
I'm open to uncertainty but prefer some structure.
No, I'm uncomfortable with ambiguity.

options.text: Yes, I can provide several examples.
I can think of an example or two.
No, I can't recall such an example.

questions.question: How do you react when faced with a situation where telling the truth might have negative consequences?

options.text: I might consider not telling the truth if it avoids negative consequences.
I tend to tell the truth, but there are exceptions.
I always prioritize telling the truth, even if it leads to negative outcomes.

questions.question: How often do you find yourself being completely truthful, even in small or insignificant matters?

options.text: Not always, I've told small lies to avoid inconvenience.
Mostly, but I've occasionally stretched the truth.
Always, I believe in being truthful in all situations.

questions.question: How do you feel when you discover that someone has lied to you?

options.text: I don't feel strongly about it, as lying is a common behavior.
I feel uncomfortable, but I understand that people have their reasons.
I feel deeply disappointed and hurt by dishonesty.

questions.question: Have you ever lied to avoid getting into trouble or facing the consequences of your actions?

options.text: Yes, I've done it frequently to avoid trouble.
Yes, I've done it a couple of times.
No, I've always faced the consequences of my actions truthfully.

questions.question: How important is trustworthiness and honesty to you in building and maintaining relationships?

options.text: Not very important, relationships can survive without complete honesty.
Somewhat important, but there are other factors too.
Very important, trust is the foundation of strong relationships.

questions.question: Do you often find yourself embellishing stories or exaggerating details to make them more interesting?

options.text: Yes, I often add details to make stories more engaging.
Occasionally, if it enhances the story.
No, I prefer to stick to the truth in my stories.

questions.question: How do you feel about telling white lies or half-truths to spare someone's feelings?

options.text: I'm comfortable using white lies to maintain harmony.
I've told white lies occasionally to avoid hurting someone.
I avoid white lies and try to be honest even in sensitive situations.

questions.question: Have you ever lied about your accomplishments or experiences to make yourself appear more impressive?

options.text: Yes, I regularly embellish my accomplishments.
Yes, I've exaggerated a few times to impress others.
No, I'm honest about my accomplishments and experiences.

questions.question: How likely are you to admit your mistakes and take responsibility for them, even if it means facing consequences?

options.text: Not very likely, I prefer avoiding admitting mistakes.
I'm willing to admit mistakes, but it depends on the situation.
Very likely, I believe in owning up to my mistakes.

questions.question: How would you describe your general attitude toward honesty and truthfulness in your daily life?

options.text: Honesty is important, but occasional lies are acceptable.
I value honesty but sometimes find it challenging.
I prioritize honesty in every aspect of my life.
